channel.title: 2 questions
channel.description: 1: how can i make it so when players log in they have completed jad ? 2: in my house i have 2 computer is it possible to play 2 players by use 127.0.0.1 ip on my other computer? or wat do i do to play 2 players?

item.title: 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:9, topic:262641”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=346800.msg2671222#msg2671222 date=1234829772]

In a DeltaScape server, it uses an integer to determine if the fight caves are completed or not. You gain the integer by killing Jad, and the integer I believe is ‘killedJad’. So add this in your Player class. I will not tell you where, it is obvious enough for the first login.

killedJad = 15;

[/quote]

Jad isn’t a quest. When you killed jad, it adds 1 to the killedJad integer and saves your character.

Proof:

temp.killedJad += 1;

Darn, you’re right.

Read full topic

In a DeltaScape server, it uses an integer to determine if the fight caves are completed or not. You gain the integer by killing Jad, and the integer I believe is ‘killedJad’. So add this in your Player class. I will not tell you where, it is obvious enough for the first login.

killedJad = 15;

[/quote][/quote]

Jad isn’t a quest. When you killed jad, it adds 1 to the killedJad integer and saves your character.

Proof:

temp.killedJad += 1;

item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:7, topic:262641”]Posted on: February 16, 2009, 06:16:59 pm[hr][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=346800.msg2671221#msg2671221 date=1234829763]
In a DeltaScape server, it uses an integer to determine if the fight caves are completed or not. You gain the integer by killing Jad, and the integer I believe is ‘killedJad’. So add this in your Player class. I will not tell you where, it is obvious enough for the first login.

killedJad = 15;

[/quote][/quote]

IF there is a minigame, then its delta source as jad is a kind of minigame (waves)…

i guess you could get rid of jad completely… lol

or you could make jad 1hp so that the players can just 1 hit it.

item.title: 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

In a DeltaScape server, it uses an integer to determine if the fight caves are completed or not. You gain the integer by killing Jad, and the integer I believe is ‘killedJad’. So add this in your Player class. I will not tell you where, it is obvious enough for the first login.

killedJad = 1;

And as for question 2, I am not sure. Just connect using the no-ip you have(if existing).

Read full topic

item.title: 2 questions
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:4, topic:262641”][quote author=xxlukexx link=topic=346800.msg2671203#msg2671203 date=1234829105]

  1. go in player.java and find what they start with (wielding) for the cape, change the id to 6570 and they should be wearing a firecape when they login.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 16, 2009, 06:08:30 pm[/size][hr]if your not using delta (even though im not sure if delta source has this)

then search for:

Giving the player an unique look

you should find something like this:

// Giving the player an unique look playerEquipment[playerHat]=2910; playerEquipment[playerCape]=4405; playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=6585; playerEquipment[playerChest]=2906; playerEquipment[playerShield]=3842; playerEquipment[playerLegs]=2495; playerEquipment[playerHands]=2912; playerEquipment[playerFeet]=2904; playerEquipment[playerRing]=-1; playerEquipment[playerArrows]=-1; playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=4587;

change

	playerEquipment[playerCape]=4405;

to:

	playerEquipment[playerCape]=6570;

[/quote]
How about, just complete the quest for them. :)[/quote]

jad isnt a quest lol…

if its delta base then i doubt you can do it as you cannot wield unless you have defeated jad.

if its not delta then just do what i said…

Read full topic
